snippet: Mr. Aubrac and his wife, Lucie, became symbols of heroism in their country’s fight against the Germans, who defeated France in 1940. Their story of valor and love was told in movies and books.
abstract: Raymond Aubrac, storied leader of the resistance effort in Nazi-occupied France during World War II, dies at age 97.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Aubrac and his wife, Lucie, became symbols of heroism in their country’s fight against the Germans, who defeated France in 1940. Their story of valor and love was told in movies and books.

headline.seo: Raymond Aubrac, a Leader of the French Resistance, Dies at 97
headline.main: Raymond Aubrac, an Exalted Leader of the French Resistance, Dies at 97
headline.print_headline: Raymond Aubrac, Leader and Symbol Of the French Resistance, Is Dead at 97
